Package: route_66¶

Module: route_66.agent¶

class route_66.agent.CarAgent(unique_id, model, tf)¶

Bases: mesa.agent.Agent

An agent with a velocity of 1-5 and a position. Random initial velocity

acceleration()¶

Increases velocity by one unit if it is smaller than CarAgent.max_velocity

Returns

The current velocity of the agent

braking()¶

If the distance between an agent and the agent in front of it is smaller than the velocity the velocity is reduced to the number of emtpy cells in front of the car

Returns

The current velocity of the agent

delete()¶

Deletes the merged agents from the on ramp that have reached the end of the main road

init_velocity = 5¶
max_velocity = 5¶
move()¶

The agent is moved forward the number of cells equal to their velocity

p = 0.5¶
randomisation()¶

If an agent’s velocity is greater than 1, it may slow down by one unit of velocity randomly with a probability of CarAgent.p

Returns

The current velocity of the agent

class route_66.agent.TrafficLight(unique_id, model, timer, ramp_begin, ramp_len)¶

Bases: object

A traffic light that holds a list with waiting cars and cars that want to merge to the main road

cars_amount = 1¶
get_free_space()¶

Checks if there exists some empty cells for an agent to merge into the main ramp Returns all the cells that are free for the agents on the on ramp to merge into

merging_cars()¶

Checks if there are agents on the on ramp and if there is room to merge to the main road Adds the agents to the main road and updates the on ramp queue

static new_agents_to_queue()¶

A function to generate an amount of agents per step to wait before the light

Returns

The amount of new cars that are added to the queue

step()¶

The update function for the traffic light

update_queues()¶

Update the queues on both sides of the traffic light

Module: route_66.batch_run¶

route_66.batch_run.plot_batch(N=[35], timer=[2], iterations=5)¶

Plots each combination of N and timer. Each combination has its own coloured dot. Each combination is run for several iterations, thus several dots.

Parameters

  • N – List of each number of initial cars on the road

  • timer – List of each timing that needs to be simulated

  • iterations – Integer of the amount of times every single combination needs to be repeated

Returns

the DataFrame associated with the batch plot

route_66.batch_run.run_batch(N=[35], timer=[2], iterations=5)¶

Runs the simulation for every combination of N and timer N is the number of Cars on the road Timer is the amount of seconds the traffic light will wait to let agents through

Parameters

  • N – List of each number of initial cars on the road

  • timer – List of each timing that needs to be simulated

  • iterations – Integer of the amount of times every single combination needs to be repeated

Returns

DataFrame with the Average Velocity and Standard Deviation of the velocity for every combination

Module: route_66.model¶

class route_66.model.RoadModel(N, length=100, lanes=1, timer=3)¶

Bases: mesa.model.Model

A model with a number of cars, Nagel-Schreckenberg

add_agent(label, x_corr)¶

Adds an agent to the scheduler and model on a particular coordinate

Parameters

  • label – The label of the agents that gets created

  • x_corr – The x-coordinate of where the agent will be spawned

delete_agent(agent)¶

Deletes an agent from the scheduler and model

Parameters

agent – The agents that gets deleted

step()¶

The model takes a new step and updates

route_66.model.get_average_velocity(model)¶

Gets the total average velocity over all the agents

Parameters

model – The model (environment) where the agents exist

Returns

The total average velocity over all the agents

route_66.model.get_standard_deviation_velocity(model)¶

Gets the total standard deviation of the velocity over all agents

Parameters

model – The model (environment) where the agents exist

Returns

The total standard deviation over all agents

Module: route_66.server¶

route_66.server.car_portrayal(agent)¶

Visualises the cars for the Mesa webserver

Returns

Dictionary containing the settings of an agent

Module: route_66.visualisation¶

route_66.visualisation.plot_simulation(steps, N, length=100, lanes=1, p=0.5, grid=False)¶

Visualises the development of traffic throughput

Parameters

  • steps – Integer of the amount of steps the simulation needs to run

  • N – List of each number of initial cars on the road

  • length – Integer of the length of the road

  • lanes – The amount of lanes the road has

  • p – The probability a car will decrease speed by one

  • grid – Boolean to show the grid on the plot or not

Returns

No return but shows the plot instead
